channel.title: Mac on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in Mac on Some Title

item.title: How to use Google Colaboratory
item.description: ![image.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/587891/ed416201-d330-975f-0707-cea8dd90ab29.png) Purpose Google Colaboratory can be used. Please see How to use Google Colaboratory for detailed explanation and code.

item.title: What to do when (base) is displayed at the beginning of the Mac terminal
item.description: After launching the Mac terminal, The familiar (base) characters at the Anaconda prompt start. By the way, I’ve been using Anaconda lately. (base)username:~$ Cause Since the setting that automatically enables the virtual environment built with Anaconda may be effective, I ran the following command to check. $ conda config --show | grep auto_activate_base Now that we have a True returned, we know we need to change the settings. auto_activate_base: True Environment ・MacOS Catalina 10.

item.title: After changing the account name on Mac, I could not use pip or ipython, so I re-installed python and it was cured
item.description: #Overview When I changed my mac account name, I couldn’t use pip or ipython installed by pyenv, so I could use python again. #environment macOS Catalina 10.15.4 Homebrew 2.2.11 pyenv 1.2.17 python 3.8.0 #Background I used brew on mac to install pyenv, and then pyenv was used to install python. After that, I changed my mac account name (and home directory name) for various reasons. Follow the official description to change the account name.

item.title: MacBook Pro でOpenPose
item.description: While studying machine learning and Deep Leaning articles on MacBook Pro, I posted an article that you can detect posture on Mac I found some and tried variously, but it worked, so I will write it as a memorandum. #environment MacBook Pro 15in 2018 2.2 GHz Core i7 32GB Memory Mojave 10.14.6 python 3.7.5 Install python, virtualenv and wget with homebrew Setup steps Preparation In preparation, set up a Python virtual environment.

item.title: Update Python on Mac from 2 to 3
item.description: # Overview This article is a step-by-step article on how a beginner himself developed a coupon distribution service for iPhone with RESTful API and swift. It was a very detouring implementation because we implemented it while examining the technical elements one by one. Python is originally installed on the Mac, but the version is old as of OS 10.15. When actually writing Python, everyone seems to have been updated to 3 series.
